github.name: get_commit
github.description: Get details for a commit from a GitHub repository

github.name: get_file_contents
github.description: Get the contents of a file or directory from a GitHub repository

github.name: get_latest_release
github.description: Get the latest release in a GitHub repository

github.name: get_me
github.description: Get details of the authenticated GitHub user. Use this when a request is about the user's own profile for GitHub. Or when information is missing to build other tool calls.

github.name: get_release_by_tag
github.description: Get a specific release by its tag name in a GitHub repository

github.name: get_tag
github.description: Get details about a specific git tag in a GitHub repository

github.name: get_team_members
github.description: Get member usernames of a specific team in an organization. Limited to organizations accessible with current credentials

github.name: get_teams
github.description: Get details of the teams the user is a member of. Limited to organizations accessible with current credentials

github.name: list_branches
github.description: List branches in a GitHub repository

github.name: list_commits
github.description: Get list of commits of a branch in a GitHub repository. Returns at least 30 results per page by default, but can return more if specified using the perPage parameter (up to 100).

github.name: list_releases
github.description: List releases in a GitHub repository

github.name: list_tags
github.description: List git tags in a GitHub repository

github.name: search_code
github.description: Fast and precise code search across ALL GitHub repositories using GitHub's native search engine. Best for finding exact symbols, functions, classes, or specific code patterns.

github.name: search_repositories
github.description: Find GitHub repositories by name, description, readme, topics, or other metadata. Perfect for discovering projects, finding examples, or locating specific repositories across GitHub.

safeoutputs.name: create_issue
safeoutputs.description: Create a new GitHub issue for tracking bugs, feature requests, or tasks. Use this for actionable work items that need assignment, labeling, and status tracking. For reports, announcements, or status updates that don't require task tracking, use create_discussion instead. CONSTRAINTS: Maximum 10 issue(s) can be created. Title will be prefixed with "[star-list-maintainer] ".

safeoutputs.name: missing_tool
safeoutputs.description: Report that a tool or capability needed to complete the task is not available, or share any information you deem important about missing functionality or limitations. Use this when you cannot accomplish what was requested because the required functionality is missing or access is restricted.

safeoutputs.name: noop
safeoutputs.description: Log a transparency message when no significant actions are needed. Use this to confirm workflow completion and provide visibility when analysis is complete but no changes or outputs are required (e.g., 'No issues found', 'All checks passed'). This ensures the workflow produces human-visible output even when no other actions are taken.

safeoutputs.name: missing_data
safeoutputs.description: Report that data or information needed to complete the task is not available. Use this when you cannot accomplish what was requested because required data, context, or information is missing.
